item.description:
One player is the quiz master and shows one of the contained 24 scenes for one minute to the other players. Afterwards the quiz master takes the picture away and poses questions of rising difficulty to the players.
They answer in secret whether the answer is "Wrong" or "Right". Depending on the difficulty of the question, the players who are right gain 1 - 3 points for their answer.
After all questions are answered, all players gain points on the main board, depending on how many points they achieved in the played scene. 
Whoever first reaches the final square on the main board, wins.

—user summary

In this interactive roll-and-write game, players draft dice and shoot torpedoes at their enemy submarine. The torpedoes are fired in the same formation as the pips shown on the dice.

Players can modify their dice rolls in various ways after activating one or more of their submarine's systems, such as the engine or propeller. But these systems may not last long, as they are being targeted by the enemy. The first player to destroy all of their enemy's vital systems, without running out of spare torpedoes, is the winner.

-description from designer

name.value: The Battle of Five Armies Collector's Edition

item.description:
The Battle of Five Armies is a stand-alone board game for two players, which recreates the fierce struggle witnessed by Bilbo Baggins at the end of his quest for the Lonely Mountain, in “The Hobbit”, the world-renowned masterpiece by J.R.R. Tolkien. Developed by the same designer team of the awarded War of the Ring board game (Francesco Nepitello, Marco Maggi and Roberto Di Meglio), The Battle of Five Armies is based on the mechanics first used in that game, merging action dice and event cards. The system is further enhanced by the addition of the “Fate Track” mechanic, handling the arrival of the allies and the triggering of special events. All the key characters in the battle – Bilbo, Gandalf, Thorin, Dain, the Elven King, Bard, Beorn, Bolg – are featured with powerful special abilities and unique sculptures.

This Collector's Edition will include a high-quality version of all the components featured in the regular, and now out-of-print, version of the game, complemented by 126 hand-painted figures, in a special deluxe packaging, and with a limited edition certificate of authenticity. It will also include "The Fate of Erebor", a previously unreleased mini-expansion including rules and components to reflect the outcome of the game in your games of War of the Ring Second Edition.

The Battle of Five Armies Collector's Edition will have a single print run, with a single print run of 1500.

The Collector's Edition of The Battle of Five Armies includes:
- 126 painted figures
- deluxe large size game board
- special hardcover edition of the rulebook printed on high-quality textured paper
- 2 deluxe player aids
- 13 limited edition action dice
- 10 limited edition combat dice
- 92 tarot-size limited edition cards
- 11 deluxe cardstock character and unit cards
- 3 cloth recruitment bags
- 1 fate token bag
- 170 deluxe counters
- “The Fate of Erebor” rules and components
- numbered Certificate of Authenticity

—description from the publisher

The Deluxe edition is the base game + both character expansions, so you'll get all 8 characters in one box.

Characters include McReady, Garry, Kinner, Copper, Van Wall, Norris, Clark and Blair.

link.value: Who Goes There: Blair and Clark Character Expansion Pack
Who Goes There: Van Wall and Norris Character Expansion Pack

item.description:
ImpeRunde is a tremendous wooden board game for 3-6 players. The colonial powers of the 18th century struggle for the control of the sea routes and influence in the colonies. If possible, they try to reach their goals in peace. But when diplomacy fails, conflict threatens. Excitement and interaction captivate the players for 3 to 8 hours. The game board with 80 cm in diameter, over 1.000 meeples and the game box are made of wood, the cotton bags are fairtrade! 
—description from the publisher

In Imperunde each player assumes the role of an eighteenth-century colony power. The goal of the game is, to be the first to set up a fixed number of trading posts and to have no debts as a colonial power. The count of trading posts is recommended by the rules according to the desired game length and number of players, but can be adjusted by the players. During the game, players must build new colonies, manage their national budgets, strategically shift armies, conduct diplomatic negotiations on war and peace, conquer other colonies, defend their own colonies, and plan and conduct their intelligence activity.

Fates is strategic, puzzle, card game for 1 to 4 players.

The Moirai Sisters, also known as The Fates, are the personification of destiny. The three sisters are daughters of Zeus and responsible for controlling the life-thread of all mankind. Together, the sisters ensure that the fate of every individual takes its course without obstruction.

Clotho has the Spindle. She is responsible for spinning the life-thread. Clotho is bound with creating life.

Lachesis has the Measure. She is responsible for allotting the life-thread. These allotments represent the life span of an individual.

Atropos has the Shears. She is responsible for cutting the life-thread. This is when the life of every person comes to an end.

There are nine Moirai Cards, three of each Sister. The Moirai Cards are shuffled and dealt in a 3x3 'Moirai Grid'.

Shuffle the 18 Puzzle Cards and deal them face-up in three piles.

Each players' goal is to manipulate the Moirai Grid in order to match one or more of the topmost Puzzle Cards. Matching the Puzzle Card to the Moirai Grid allows you to claim the matched Puzzle Cards. The first player to claim an agreed number of Puzzle Cards wins.

—description from the publisher

Poka Yoke is a combinatorial game for two players. It's the follow-up to Tixel and Regatta.

The rules of Poka Yoke are exactly like the Tixel rules (see below) with the addition of the following 'piece promotion' rule:

If in a single turn a player picks up 1 of her own pieces (during a bonus move) to end the turn, then the picked up piece is promoted to a Regatta piece.
In any single game at most 2 pieces per player can be promoted in this fashion.

Brief description of the Tixel rules:
On a turn, a player can either place a new Tixel piece or move one of her own Tixel pieces already on the board. A Tixel piece can be "active" or "inactive"; only active pieces, which are at a 45º angle, may be moved. Making pieces inactive is done by moving next to or passing an active piece.
Chaining moves is important as this temporarily unlocks three additional move types (aside from placing or moving a piece). If a piece that is moved is made inactive at its end position — i.e., it's sacrificed — a player can take an extra move if she so chooses; aside from placing or moving a piece, she can now remove a piece from the board, activate an inactive piece, or pivot an active piece to reorient its hollow side.

name.value: GROM: Un mondo di gelati e agricoltura

item.description:
We have combined GROM's expertise in everything related to the selection of raw materials, nature, food and the ingredients necessary to make the "best gelato in the world" with our creativity and experience in combining fun with educational content, and we have created the box that you have just opened.

Working together we have discovered that we have a common sensitivity towards the environment and people, attention to the little details that make the difference and we have put them in the box.

I hope you have time, because the game... lasts one year! It lasts the four seasons to let you taste the best ingredients of each of them, represented by the tree in the middle of the board that you can dress and cover with its colorful flowers, leaves and snowflakes.

A game lasts 4 rounds: one for each season.

In each season only those who complete a cup with at least three flavors of gelato earn points. To make a flavor you need the three basic ingredients and the ingredient of the flavor itself (eg. hazelnut or strawberry). The ingredients are won in the respective areas of the board and in the seasons in which they are available (e.g. fish at Mura Mura, but only in summer). The winner of the game is the one who, at the end of the fourth season, has scored the most points.

name.value: Men of Bronze: Ancient Greek Hoplite Battles

item.description:
Men of Bronze is a wargame that allows you to play out Classical Greek hoplite battles on the tabletop. Players are Strategoi (generals) leading phalanxes of bronze-clad warriors in pursuit of fame, glory, and the honor of their city-states. To win such prizes, however, you must prove your mettle, display your valor, and bring the other Strategoi to their knees!

Designed to recreate small battles or larger skirmishes with 50-80 figures per side, each army will have its own unique mix of rules, advantages, backgrounds, and abilities. Strategoi must understand and appreciate the strengths and weaknesses of their forces in order to win glory on the battlefield. Of course, there's no telling what tricks a rival Strategos might have up their tunic sleeves.

-description from publisher

Dice of Dragons is a 2-6 player game, with players taking on the roles of valiant knights fighting a dragon which has captured gold from the Realm. Capture the gold from the dragon, to bring back to the kingdom, and win favor from the Crown!

But you are not alone in this fight, and others seek the crown’s favor for themselves! So you will need to bring back more than your opponents. The dragon is also not happy to give this gold up, and will put up a fight to keep it.

Players roll all the available dice on their turn, and choose to take actions based on those rolls. Get 3 or mode swords and you can attack the dragon. Get 3 or more shields and you can get a warrior token. If you get 3 or more flames your turn immediately ends.

If you get flags, you must immediately pass them out to other players who then immediately roll. Flames can be given to any player at the table, and are kept this way until the end of that player's turn. Swords can be kept, and used during anyone's dragon attack...or saved for that player's turn. Shields and flags are returned.

As with the other "Dice of" games, the player decides when to stop rolling. Do they push their luck risking 3 or more flames...or use what they have?

If players attack the dragon, they roll a special dragon die to determine how much gold they steal. Warriors may be added to the fight to gain extra gold, and other players may submit their sword dice to also get gold.

At the end of the round, the dragon attacks the player with the most gold, rolling the dragon die to determine how much they lose. Being in the lead is risky, but warrior tokens can be used to help protect the gold (as they are lost first).

Once all the dragon's gold is gone, the player with the most gold wins!


 
 
 


Added to the game is a brand new Co-Operative mode, where players must band together and strategize their play in order to defeat the dragon together and win the game!

-description from publisher

name.value: Murder à la Carte: Murder in the Orient

item.description:
Shanghai, 1937. It's a confused, chaotic and cosmopolitan kind of town. Local businessman, Fu Manchuria has invited a mixed group to his house to have dinner, but regrettably the host himself will not be present. He's been detained upstairs. Detained by person or persons unknown. He was found in his bedroom, bound and gagged, and with an ivory chopstick through his heart. In short, he's dead.

So who killed him? It can only be one of his guests, which
means that at least one of you is the murderer. Luckily the
private detective Marlowe McClue is here to help you find out who that person is.

name.value: Harry Potter: Une Année à Poudlard

item.description:
You just received your letter to enter the most famous School of Witchcraft and Wizardry "Hogwarts" directed by the greatest wizard of all time Albus Dumbledore.

You will win the game by owning the most House points, awarded by participating in Quidditch match, duelling, spending your exams in the classrooms, completing your missions, and more...

Have fun by playing all Harry potter and friends adventures.
3 game-mode : "Beginner Wizard", "Advanced Wizard or Teaming", "Return of Lord Voldemort".
The game can play solo.

Relive all the Harry Potter saga thanks to 30 dedicated missions: 

 1 to 10 : Book and Film 1, 2 and 3
 11 to 20 : Book and Film 4 and 5
 21 to 30 : Book and Film 6 and 7




Box contains :
1 main board
3 annex boards
210 cards
30 Missions cards 
60 House points tokens
36 Objects tokens 
20 Floo powder tokens
10 Portkey tokens
15 character sheet + pawns

—description from the publisher (translated)

Vous venez de recevoir votre lettre d’acceptation pour entrer dans la plus grande école de sorcellerie au Monde « Poudlard » dirigée par le plus grand sorcier de tous les temps Albus Dumbledore. 
Remportez la coupe des quatre maisons en participant aux matchs de Quidditch et au club de duel. 
Passez vos examens dans les salles de cours et réalisez vos missions ou vous revivrez toutes les aventures d'Harry Potter et de ses amis.

 3 modes de jeux : «sorcier de premier cycle», «sorcier majeur en équipe», «retour de Lord Voldemort» (le jeu peut se jouer seul) 
 Revivez toute la saga à travers les 30 missions (1 à 10 : Films et Livres 1, 2 et 3), (11 à 20 : Films et Livres 4 et 5), (21 à 30 : Films et Livres 6 et 7).




Contenu du jeu : 
1 plateau principal 
3 plateaux annexes 
210 cartes 
30 cartes « Missions » 
60 jetons « Coupe des Quatre Maisons » 
36 jetons « Objets » 
20 jetons « Poudre de Cheminette » 
10 jetons « Portoloin » 
15 fiches personnage et 15 pions

—description from the publisher (French)

name.value: Murder Mystery Party: Murder on the Orient

item.description:
Renata Scoop an English journalist investigating a smuggling ring involved with Thai antiques, was attending a riverside party at the Siam orchid hotel in Bangkok when she received a call on her mobile phone during the display of traditional Thai dancing. She left the party briefly only to be found dead a few moments later in the exotic gardens

Host your own party to find out who was responsible for disconnecting her line.

—description from the publisher

name.value: Murder Mystery Party: Murder in the Pits

item.description:
The post race party is being held by the sponsors of the Formula 1 racing team Team Rex at the Sin Bin Ring in the city of Muchodosho in the Sultanate of Djuluvmee. However before the party begins the owner Rex Motors is found dead. Who was responsible for stopping him in his tracks? Host your own party to see who waved the chequered flag.

—description from the publisher

name.value: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Change Is Constant

item.description:
Taking on the role of one of their favorite "Heroes in a Half Shell" or their allies, in Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Change Is Constant players battle their way through scenario-driven campaigns focused on retelling the stories of the IDW comics or one of the many one-shot, quick play missions. Heroes have to battle it out against a team of villains played by either a villain player (in the 4vs1 mode) or an AI-controlled villain (in the co-operative mode). Depending on the game mode chosen, missions generally take between 30-120 minutes.

Change Is Constant is volume one in IDW's series of "Adventures"-branded miniatures games. Both it and volume two (City Fall) are standalone games, while also being compatible with one another. Change Is Constant follows the first two story arcs of IDW's TMNT comic universe series, while City Fall focuses on the story of one turtle's unexpected recruitment into the Foot Clan.

Each standalone box contains five unique heroes and a variety of villains associated with each story, with more than forty miniatures total.

link.value: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: City Fall
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Shadows of the Past

item.description:
A brand new Monopoly set, special edition of popular property trading game, Monopoly!

The Chester Cathedral edition is something very special, as it comes with six bespoke game tokens exclusive to the Cathedral – including a jolly monk (The Benedictine History), A goose (St Werburgh's famous Legend), Chester Cathedral tower, A pilgrim shell, The 'Elephant & Castle' carving, A Church mouse!

The game is designed so that you get a feel of exploring the Cathedral on a tour around the board. You can buy the game in the Cathedral Gift Shop itself or on their online shop.

name.value: Murder Mystery Party: Death of a Chef

item.description:
Head chef Russell Uppermeal has invited friends and colleagues to help him being awarded the "Most Ridiculously Expensive Meal" for his battered oysters in unicorn sauce. Host your own party to find out who carved him up!

—description from the publisher

name.value: Murder Mystery Party: Murder by Degrees

item.description:
Professor Morrie R Tee, the famous Criminologist and Master if St Rumpet's College, Oxbridge, is guest of honour at the graduation of the 1000th student to successfully complete the Bachelor ot Arts Degree in Detection (B.A.D). However, all does not go according to plan and the Professor is found dead in his rooms whilst having afternoon tea. Did someone tamper with his teapot or was it written in the leaves?

Host your own party to discover who was responsible for this dastardly deed.

—description from the publisher

name.value: Murder à la Carte: A Cat on the Catwalk

item.description:
Fran was a designer in the swinging sixties, Models, photographers and the own of a purple rolls royce all features in her glamorous life, but not always as friends. For Fran manipulated people and one night one person could stand it no longer...

—description from the publisher

Toni Totti famous Italian center forward is to be formally signed by Malechester United Football club following the home league game against Malechester Rovers. He didn't arrive at the post match party but was found dead floating in the team bath in the changing rooms.

Host your own party to find out who was responsible for giving him his red card.

—description from the publisher

Matt Finish, the interior designer star of the TV show Changing Homes and Gardens, was to be the guest of honour at a party to celebrate the final days filming of the weekend makeover of Mr and Mrs Tipp's house by the C.H.A.G. team. He didn't make it to the party but was found dead in the walled vegetable garden. Host your own party to see who had designs on his murder!

—description from the publisher

name.value: Murder Mystery Party: Murder on the Piste

item.description:
Who Killed Richard Pickle? The time is the present and wealthy entrepreneur Richard Pickle has invited friends to a brunch party at his chalet in the Swiss ski resort of Kloisters. Before the party Richard went for his early morning ski and tragically sometime later was found dead lying in the virgin snow.

Host your own party and find out who is the murderer on the piste!

—description from the publisher

In Ninjaaa’Tack, communicate with your teammate to be the first ones to assemble your Ninja clan.

When your team manages to collect 4 identical cards of the same clan, your team earns a Clan token.
To do this, you and your teammate must collectively have all 4 identical cards.
When you think your team has assembled a clan, tap the gong and shout, “Ninjaaaa!” If it's correct, the team wins the clan's token.

A team wins the game when it has 3 differents tokens!

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
In the abstract game Tasso, each player starts the game with the same number of sticks. On a turn, a player lays one of their sticks on the game board or on sticks already present on the game board; whenever a player lays a stick on two sticks already laid, they immediately take another turn. (Note that a stick cannot support more than one other stick.) Whoever first places all of their sticks on the game board wins!

Tasso Safari keeps the same gameplay as Tasso, but the action is moved to the Africa with sticks of different lengths that represent giraffes, elephants, lions, and zebras. Kilimanjaro and Lake Victoria both make an appearance, offering both beauty and obstacles around which players must maneuver. Can you take your animal sticks to the next level?

The largest copper mine in Ancient Hindustan was a maze of dark tunnels deep below the earth. Miners could easily get lost, and when water and rocks blocked the tunnels, they struggled to return to daylight.

Move your miner from tile to tile until it reaches the opposite corner. Movement depends on the number and direction of the rays on the tile it occupies. Each turn, players shift a row of tiles to block other players or open up a route for themselves.

LOST IS ONLY AVAILABLE AS PART OF THE ANCIENT WORLD MULTI GAME SYSTEM FROM PLAYFORD GAMES

—description from the publisher

Greece circa 800 BCE

As war and famine threatened the Greek city-states, people despaired, and there seemed to be no way out. They begged the stargazers to call on the heavenly forces of mist, shadow, fog, and darkness to change the future. Which force will deliver them from crisis? Luckily the light always shines.

Push rows of tiles so that your color tiles for a continuous path from one side of the board to the other. Be on your guard as the tiles are shifted at every turn. Will you conceal your color from other players, or with more than two players, will luck or cooperation lead to victory?

STELLA IS ONLY AVAILABLE AS PART OF THE ANCIENT WORLD MULTI GAME SYSTEM

—description from the publisher

Ararat circa 25,000 BCE

The Lord saw how great man’s wickedness on the earth had become and every inclination of the thoughts of his heart was only evil all of the time. The Lord was grieved that he had made man on the earth and his heart was filled with pain. So the Lord said, “I will wipe mankind, whom I have created, from the face of the earth. I am going to bring floodwaters on the earth and to destroy all life under the heavens.”

Players move their people disks according to one of the adjacent tiles. As tiles are removed one by one, player's people drown and they are out of the game. The winner is the last player who has people that have not drowned.

—description from the designer

South Africa from 20,000 BCE

For centuries, African tribesmen gazed into the heavens searching for the falling star which would return the ghosts of the dead to the earth.

Be the first to connect two opposite sides of the board by using the rays of the tiles to join the path up. Clear a path for yourself and remove your opponent's tiles.

RAYS IS ONLY AVAILABLE AS PART OF THE ANCIENT WORLD MULTI GAME SYSTEM

—description from the publisher

Fists & Fury is a tactical combat game where the players create their individual fighters through a simple process, and pit them against each other in one-on-one, or even group combat, utilizing a hex-grid and tokens. Included are rules for:


 Building a unique Fighter
 Creating a unique style
 Advice on setting up duels and tournaments
 Adding and using weapons


Designed to be a "beer & pretzels" game with minimal preparation, Fists & Fury is flexible enough to handle most any style of play you can imagine within the genre.
—description from the publisher

Fists & Fury is a simple hex-and-counter miniatures wargame that focuses on small combats. Each counter represents a single combatant. Each combatant has unique skills derived from an available pool of combat "styles" that are reminiscent of pop-culture martial arts. Combatants are further specialized by buying abilities using a points pool.

Players take alternating turns. Within a turn, movement and combat are rather free-form; attacks are resolved using two ten-sided dice, with modifiers, and results are applied immediately. Players may set their own victory conditions, but the default condition is complete destruction of the opposing force. The game is unusual in allowing much variety in the individual units, with significant player decisions made during unit construction (this also is a somewhat time-consuming pre-play process).

The game is published as a print-and-play instruction manual.

—User summary

They’ve discovered an ancient Shrine under the surface of a Mountain, filled with treasures… and traps.
The traps serve as sacrifice altars to the unknown god of the Deep.
You can activate the traps to hinder your opponents, and to gain the favour of the unknown god.
Gather as many treasures as you can, but firstly, survive!

The game has 8 rounds, in each round each player chooses a trap type secretly, and then each players moves her/his character in the Shrine spending action points. 
You can move, take treasures and heal yourself in your turn for the action points. But move carefully! Each space on the gameboard can contain a secret trap - activated by another player - so you have to pay attention to each other's movements to be able to find out which traps will be activated and so which spaces are safe for that round.
After each player spent their action points, you activate the traps and check who got hit by them (gathering wounds/curses/crippling effects). If you were able to hit another player with your trap, you gain grace from the unknown god of the Deep (this god is really fond of blood sacrifices...)

Besides of the visible treasures in the Shrine, there are a few hidden treasures too - called the fragments of the Heart of the Earth - which you can only find if you collect the matching map pieces from the tunnels. This treasures worth a lot at the end of the game, so you should try to gather more of them.

At the end of the game you count the points for the treasures, graces and for your health (if you are really hurt, it could be minus points, cause treasures are not so fun if you crippled yourself permanently...), and the player with the most points wins the game.

—description from the designer

For over 2000 years the Chinese have tried to dominate their neighbors to the south. The last time was 1979 when the PRC invaded Vietnam in response to the latter's invasion and occupation of Cambodia. That war lasted about four weeks before China withdrew, having declared its mission accomplished. 
 Now, the old foes are at it once again. Sparring over the resource rich areas of the South China Sea, both sides have been slowly edging toward the precipice of war. That day has now come.

Next War: Vietnam is the fifth game in the Next War Series. This game returns the action to Asia and the powderkeg surrounding the South China Sea. This time the Chinese don't intend a limited, punitive expedition; they intend to squash the burgeoning threat from their southern border once and for all and prove, through force of arms, that the South China Sea is theirs. Building on the naval rules showcased Next War: Taiwan, players will have a chance to fight over the Spratly and Paracel Islands once again, as well as the mountainous jungle of North Vietnam. 
 If the U.S. gets involved, it might finally land troops in Haiphong Harbor and march on Hanoi, albeit as a relief force and an ally to its former enemy. The question is what will the rest of the region do? Will they join a side or stay neutral?
 Next War: Vietnam will also allow players to play a combined game with Next War:Taiwan, and, with the rules in the latter game, adding on NextWar: Korea as well for what would amount to the Pacific Front of World War III. 
 Ownership of any previous Next War Series will NOT be required to play Next War: Vietnam.

Units: 
 Next War: Vietnam primarily represents divisions and brigades of the armies of the People's Republic of China (PRC) and the Socialist Republic of Vietnam (SRV). All ground units are rated for their attack and defense strengths, movement capabilities, and unit efficiency. The Vietnamese People's Self Defense Force is represented both by units and special rules. 
 Air units represent the fighter, bomber, and attack squadrons of the major combatants. They are rated for All-Weather Capabilities, range, average pilot skill and training, and their capabilities in Air-to-Air Combat, Close Air Support, and Strike missions. 
 Naval units represent an abstraction of groups of ships (task forces) and allow players to conduct amphibious invasions, naval combat, naval gunfire support, and more. 
 Maps and Terrain 
 The game’s map represents the area in and around the northern border of Vietnam at a scale of roughly 7.5 miles per hex. The map stretches from just west of Dien Bien Phu, Vietnam to just east of Nanning, China and just north of the PRC-SRV border to a few miles south of Thanh Hoa, Vietnam. 
 The Spratlys, Paracels, and other sea areas are represented by a Strategic Display incorporating Land Areas and At Sea Boxes similar to the one in Next War: Taiwan. 
 Game System 
 A game turn is composed of:

Weather Determination wherein bad weather can severely hamper air and naval operations activity and can significantly slow ground operations. 
Initiative Determination and Air/Naval Phase, wherein Air Superiority levels and air availability are determined and Sea Control is established or modified.
Special Operations Phases in the Advanced Game allow players to utilize their special operators in various recon and raid missions behind enemy lines. 
Strike Phases in the Advanced Game allow players to launch air strikes, cruise missiles, and artillery and SSM strikes. 
One or more Movement and Combat Phases that allow both sides to move, react, and fight, with an advantage to the Initiative player on non-Contested turns. 
Arrival of Reinforcements and Replacements 
Victory Determination

Combat resolution examines not only unit strengths but also unit efficiency (representing training, doctrine, and morale), as well as the terrain where the combat takes place. The CRT tends to be very bloody in nature, reflecting what we believe will be a degree of attritional warfare early due to the lethality of modern weapons. As in many games, casualties represent not only actual combat losses but also losses of unit cohesion brought about by the rapid pace with which modern armies are able to engage and exploit on the battlefield.

Scenarios

There are several Standard Game scenarios. Some are small and focus on limited objectives, while at least one will be a campaign game encompassing the entire map. Similarly to previous games in the series, the Advanced Game scenarios will be divided into various starting points representing different levels of build-up before the game begins.

Next War: Vietnam puts you in command of the potential conflict. Can you, as the Chinese player, enforce your will on Vietnam and achieve your goals in the South China Sea, shaping your position in world affairs? Or will you, as the Vietnamese player, once again successfully defend against your larger northern neighbor?

Hello, American citizen! Do you have what it takes to achieve the American Dream during America's Golden Age?

A newfound national identity of consumerism during the 1950s and '60s may have made it look easy, but this was a time of war, nuclear weapons, discrimination and violence, and even illegal CIA mind control experiments.

Never fear! Americana: The Card Game makes it easy to try your hand at the American Dream with a historical take on issues such as race, gender, socioeconomics, and more. But of course, even in the land of the free, some of us have advantages over others...

Americana: The Card Game tackles complicated issues such as intersectionality, discrimination, and more with gameplay that is straightforward and easy to pick up. Like our gender, race, social status, and so on, much of Americana: The Card Game comes down to chance, and player skill is not a necessity. Games can include 2-6 players and typically take around 15 minutes to play.

Each of the 108 cards centers on a historical event, popular culture, or some other aspect of mid-20th century life. In addition to a brief description for each card, most cards also include a hand-drawn illustration and a metaphorical in-game action, representing its real-world historical impact.

Almost every card in Americana: The Card Game has a positive or negative effect toward your American Dream, due to the card's numeric value, the action outlined on the card, or both.

Different card categories include various positive- and negative-value cards with different sets of card actions. These categories include: Race, Gender, Socioeconomics, Environment, Government, Queerness, and Consumer. By presenting American history through a variety of lenses, players are encouraged to reflect upon what is and is not fair within a society.

The Race, Gender, Socioeconomics, and Queerness categories offer an additional sub-category of cards known as Demographic cards. These cards are played immediately and provide an advantage over other players for the duration of the game by granting you bonus cards. For example, after drawing the "You Are White" card, you then get to draw bonus cards when you draw Race cards. By giving players who are lucky enough to draw Demographic cards an unfair advantage over the other players, this mechanic illustrates how some members of American society during the 1950s and '60s (and today) benefited from social privilege.

Players start Americana: The Card Game with empty hands. On your turn, draw a card from the deck and add it to your hand, then play a card face-up toward your American Dream. Oftentimes, players are forced to play negative-value cards due to a sparse hand. Once the card has been played, commit any action indicated on the card. These actions typically involve drawing a card, discarding a card, forcing another player to discard a card, and so on.

There is only one deck in Americana: The Card Game. Discarded cards are placed on the bottom of the deck and players with poor hands may have to draw from the bottom of a (literally) stacked deck. Additionally, players lucky enough to draw positive-value or even Demographic cards will find themselves adding more and more cards to their hands, while players drawing mostly negative-value cards will struggle to maintain a hand. Of course, luck can change.

Once the net value of the cards played toward a player's American Dream reaches 10+, that player has won the game.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

From the rear of the box:
Welcome to the special P&O Cruises edition of Monopoly.
Whatever you dream of from your holiday, P&O Cruises provide. An escape from routine? Without doubt. A resort that offers every luxury you can think of? A destination that is every bit as exciting and memorable as the amazing and unforgettable places you visit? It's a done deal. The ships of our fleet offer it all, and then some.

Each of our ships is a world in herself, a world of luxury, of fine dining, world-class entertainment and blissful relaxation. Whichever ship you step aboard, you'll feel your horizon expanding with the endless possibilities for sheer delight on offer at every turn. A world where your meals are lovingly crafted by our Food Heroes, and your entertainment is provided in a theatre that's state of the art(s). Where you can unwind with a massage in our relaxing spa. And where your view is ever fascinating and ever changing.

If only there was a phrase that perfectly captured all those perfect little moments you'll experience on a P&O Cruises holiday. Ah, yes...

PROPERTIES
BROWN
Amsterdam / Guernsey
LIGHT BLUE
??? / ??? / ???
PINK 
??? / ??? / ???
ORANGE 
??? / ??? / ???
RED 
Stockholm / ??? / ???
YELLOW 
??? / ??? / ???
GREEN 
San Francisco / Dubai / ???
DARK BLUE 
Sydney / Hong Kong
STATIONS
??? / ??? / ??? / Market Café with Eric Lanlard
UTILITIES
??? / ???
TAXES
??? / ???
COMMUNITY CHEST / CHANCE
Captain’s Chest / Ship’s Luck

name.value: Reveal: All the Colors of Kink

item.description:
Reveal is a Fun and Sexy Adult Board Game centered around sexuality and Kinks that you can play with friends, whatever type of Relationship you have with them.

Reveal is designed to fit 4 type of players: From the ones that just want to have a good laugh to people in the Lifestyle.

However you want to play Reveal, you choose the Level at the beginning and The Game will adapt to it.

The game is casual like Cards against Humanity or other similar game.

Any player can end the game, by collecting enough points to call an exit but what we noticed is that players in fact play until the cards rotate enough to go back to the same questions again. It's rare to see someone who quits Reveal.

The Game has 8 set of cards:

 4 Set of questions with hidden point, strip and Joker cards
 4 Set of Dares




The 4 set of questions are Experience, Opinion, Intimacy and Fantasy.
The 4 Set of Dares are in fact 4 level.

You spin a wheel at the center of the board when it is your turn, to determinate which category you will have to pick a question from.
Whatever category you end up during your turn, you can get a question, a joker (counter card), a Strip card (optional) or a Point cards.


 Question are cards you need to answer. You will be judge by the other participants on your answer. If half of them judge that your answer is not satisfactory, then you have to put back one of your point card or Joker card in the pile of card.
 Point card are collected to buy a dare to impose on anyone - when you have enough of them.
 Strip card if used, request you to remove a piece of cloth.
 Joker card enable you to counter a question, a dare or a strip card


Choose Your Level Before Playing

There is 4 ways to play Reveal: from casual to progressively sexual charged.

If you play level 1 of the game (to play with any type of friends OK to talk about kinks and sex). You will only be able to access the Dares from level 1 that you can purchase with the points you collect randomly as you pick up a card during your turn.

If you play level 2, only dare level 1 and 2 will be accessible, making the dare a little bit more provocative but still playable with friends.

At level 3, level 1,2 and 3 of the Dares are accessible. Now we are talking about Dares including 2 participants. So everyone need to be comfortable with that.

At least, level 4 includes all the dares. this last Level will make the game sexual and is designed for people in the Lifestyle.

Depending of the Level you choose to play, it will be more or less easy to counter dares and Strip cards. As you can imagine, at level 1, it takes some points to buy a Dare but it's easy to counter it.
At level 4, it is the opposite: Dares are easily purchase with points but hard to counter with Joker.

Strip cards can be completely removed from the game before starting. It doesn't change the fun of the playing Reveal. It just a choice you make to have people losing their Joker faster or not countering Strip cards.

—description from the designers

Quantic Dojo is an imaginative evolution of Tic-Tac-Toe that has the strategic potential and replay value of Chess. The goal of this balanced two-player game is to get three in a row anywhere on the board, but players can place their pieces only in the middle nine squares.

Each piece has a unique attack that, if placed correctly, can push an opposing piece to another square. This action can cause several things to happen. If the attacked piece runs into any other pieces, that piece gets moved, too. Also if the attacked piece is pushed into the attack zone of a piece you already have on the board, your established piece will attack. Finally, a player gets their piece back if it is pushed off the board.

A card game where players link together a series of wand movement cards with a magic word to cast spells. There are three different game modes, each with a different objective to be achieved by the spell being cast. These three standard game types either encourage precise wand movements; promote expertise at casting longer more skilful spells; or pit players against each other in a classic wizarding duel!

Ka-Zing can be enjoyed by players of all ages, and has a built in difficulty mechanic where simultaneous play is possible between the easiest “learn to play” difficulty level (ideal for new or younger players) and the standard difficulty level (for more experienced players). Ka-Zing also comes with an advanced level of difficulty, unlocking more complex wand movements for players who like a challenge.

Ka-Zing can be played in Solo mode, as a group of 2-5 players, and even as a co-operative competitive mode, where players can form teams to compete against the other teams.

—description from the publisher

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

name.value: Death Ride Kursk: III Panzer Korps

item.description:
III Panzer Korps: This game is the Base Game for the AD Kempf Game Set.

Scenarios for this game start on 4 July and through 13 July when they failed to meet up with the IISS Panzer Korps at Prokhorovka.

Inside this base game there is a consderably larger amount of material than in past Death Ride base games. The reason is that there are 4 full German Divisions involved and all in one game. That makes this a 2 box set. It will be very worth it though with all those units inside.

III Panzer Korps - Base Game - comes with (in Full Color):

 (34) Map Sections of the Donets River Area of Operations
 (10) Scenario Cards
 Order of Battle Cards
 Task Organization Cards
 5000+ Unit Counters and Markers

Traveling with monks pawns, players experience many adventures together with St. Francis, for example, help poor people by sharing bread, talking with a wolf, dressing sick deer and others. 
The contestants get a mission to collect all the fruits of the Holy Spirit (Love, Joy, Peace, Patience, Kindness, Goodness, Faithfulness, Gentleness, and Self-control). Strolling along the stone streets, they decide which way to go to get individual tokens.

The goal of the game is to collect the nine fruits of the Holy Spirit as soon as possible and to come with them to St. Francis.

Explore, exploit, expand, colonize!

Earth is in peril, if we want to survive we have to leave or it will be the end of the human race. In Colonize! you are the captain of the biggest space ark of your nation. With that giant spaceship you will explore the unknown space, exploit the resources you find, terraform planets and lastly bring your population there! Each of these efforts of colonization will grant you Victory points. But beware, your ship’s reactor produce dangerous radioactive wastes! These wastes take a tremendous space in your cargo's ship. Will you recycle them on Earth or will you simply dump them in deep space? The game end after 8 turns, so you will have to make a lot of choices if you hope a to find a new home for your survivors stranded on a over polluted earth.

Quick Gameplay overview:
Every player start by placing their ship on Earth’s tile.
At the beginning of a turn each player take a Waste token and put it at the start of their energy track on their Spaceship board. In a clockwise order, each player spend 2 energy points to make actions, moving their Waste token as a marker along the energy track. Actions may include :


 Hauling population or resources into your spaceship
 Moving through space tiles
 Exploring the unknown space
 Using space artifacts
 Installing a Station on a planet
 Exploiting the resources of a planet
 Terraforming a planet and building a Colony


When the waste token reach the end of the track, it is moved into the ship’s cargo space. Every player put a new Waste token on their energy track and a new turn begin ! The game ends when there is no more waste token available.

—description from the publisher

Imperium Romanum is an update to the classic game of the Roman Empire by Al Nofi. The rules cover the intricacies of the political, economic, and military conflicts of the Roman world from the first century BC to its fall nearly 700 years later. The game includes over 40 scenarios, with six new scenarios and three introductory scenarios. Scenarios range from the Mithridatic wars (88-63 BC) through more than six centuries of greatness and decline to the final burst of glory in the last Romano-Persian War (AD 622-629). Two to six persons may play, depending on the scenario chosen. Scale is 50 miles to the hex and each unit represents Legions and Fleets. Most leader counters are named and represent individual leaders and their staffs.

Imperium Romanum includes counter graphics with all units displayed in a neutral color while the players use leader and control markers to show the forces each faction controls. The maps are enlarged and have a directory of all provinces with their cultivated and road status depicted for each scenario. The rules are updated with a new format and include new optional rules designed to give all players more detail in the military, logistical and political actions of the game.

New Scenarios:

Pompey versus the Pirates (AD 101-102)
Trajan’s Parthian War (AD 115-117)
Heraclius and the last Persian War (AD 622-629)
Introductory solitaire scenario

—description from the publisher

The game has been waiting for players with unusual solutions. The first was the playfield of 64 spaces and out of numbered rectangles.
The second striking difference affects the figures, three of which are of the same size, but the fourth one is much larger. According to the description it is important in this second game mode.
The third striking difference is the dice, which is not a cube but a numbered octahedron.
The game can be played in two ways.
The goal is to get the figures from the starting place to the designated destination locations.

—user summary

Pathogenesis is a deck building game in which players take the role of bacterial pathogens attacking the human body.

The game was developed in partnership with scientific illustrator somersault1824. The game is based on 100% real science and the mechanics were created to mimic how real biology works.

Avid deck builder players will feel at home playing the game as the mechanic foundation was based on several popular deck builders. The mechanics have evolved and mutated during the creation into a game that is quite its own.

The game offers several modes of play including solo play, cooperative, competitive, and team play.

No knowledge of science is required to play but it was developed to enhance the learning of the immune system at the college level.

Second Edition:

The immune system for the 2nd edition of Pathogenesis has been updated. These updates include 4 immune system cards (4 copies of each) that are more consistently damaging than before as well as updated antibody tokens that have an attack value of their own. The adaptive immune system response is now less volatile and even more dangerous than before!

A great stand-alone game or the followup to Journey into Draught!

Chuglox, Daiquirin, Bartlebut and Annoying Sidekick are back! But this time they're really out of shape from all the drinking!

Quests include:

Rekt On Rum (Booze-filled pirate adventures)

Hangover Bay (Ship wrecked because of the all the drinking)

Sticky Thicket (This quest is all about BEES)

Fizz Fang’s Freezer (A chilly dungeon crawl to defeat a foul dragon)

And bonus quests:

A) Hop Garden Rehab (A quest to drink water and sober up)

B) Bar Trek (Futuristic sci-fi parody)

—description from the publisher

Borderhaime: Chronicles is a tactical board game of co-operative card-driven tactical turn-based combat with 40 hours of story campaign gameplay.

In this hardcore adventure, you are tasked with completing ten levels of a hellish dungeon. Under your control is a character with nine types of stats that have a huge impact on your gameplay and walkthrough style. It doesn't matter which character class you choose as you will always have an option to re-spec your hero. For example, you can start off playing as a mage, but spec it into a tank, or vice versa.

By defeating enemies, you receive experience and loot that allows you to level up and create your unique hero. You can also increase your stats by equipping armor, accessories, and weapons. In order for the hero to be able to use an item, their stats need to pass the use requirement threshold. New items are available for purchase in town or can be looted from monsters.

The main goal of the story mode is to reach to final level of the dungeon. Each level hold a quest mission, new items, and tougher enemies. All enemies in the game are automated, with their behavior, tactics, and stats described on monster cards. Enemy actions are to be done by the player that has drawn the monster card.

What’s the Point is a balanced and fun card game that takes less than 5 minutes to learn and is made for people who like dominating in family game nights.

What’s the Point is all about collecting 3 of a kind of any card in order to earn points. The first player to earn 5 points wins! Sounds easy right? NOPE! Other players can use ACTION CARDS to take away your points, skip your turn or stop your action card all together. Be smart and play your cards at the right time so you can claim victory!

—description from the publisher

AndThen... is a group creative writing game that encourage and combines your group's collective humor and creativity into hilarious stories...about each other!

Each box contains enough material for up to 8 players to play the game. To play with up to 35 players, combine multiple boxes.

To play, take turns filling in the dry-erase flip-books and passing them around the circle until all the stories are completed. Then take turns reading the stories out loud to the group.

Before each round, the group decides before each round how the winner is to be determined. For example, the winner could be the player who comes up with the best one-liner, as decided by a final vote. Or the player who is featured in the most stories, which would be a simple tally. If the group determines to play "just for fun", then this game becomes an activity (similar to how Telestrations is usually played as a picture-based conversation activity). Although even when played as an "activity", players often still strategize ways to excel over other players or seek revenge in later rounds.

—description from the publisher

Player picks a card and draws the subject of that card on a plastic mask in front of their own face. Other players guess the subject. A correct guess allows the drawing player and the guessing player to both advance on the board.

You have trains, they are in space.
Welcome to the Galaxy of Trains in Space! This is a tabletop card game for 2-4 players. It can be played with the standard rules specified in the Operations Guide, or with modified rules for alternate play.

In the distant future, where humans have reached far beyond our own solar system, the colonies are expected to supply Earth with the resources that it has long-since depleted. But lately the colonies have stopped sending back supplies, so the Czar of Space has readied his military to wipe out all of the colonies unless they can prove they are worth keeping. A plea went out and he's agreed to spare just ONE space colony if it can prove that it produces more valuable resources than the others. The colonies' leaders quickly sent out their Mighty Space Trains to appease the Czar, but in their panic, they all left EMPTY!

This is where you come in; as Engineers for each colony's respective Space Trains, you must grab random junk along the way and load it onto your Train before reaching Earth. That's right, it's your job to fake the value of your colony for its survival! Don't let the other Engineers get the better of you, load your train and blast their cargo with weapons you'll find. Defend your colony, and prove that you have what it takes to be the ultimate Engineer on the Trains in Space!

Featuring elements of Roleplay, Press your Luck, Set Collection, Take That and Pool building gameplay as you become the Engineers for your Space Trains in order to acquire the most valuable load out of space-junk to save your Colony.

—description from the designer

Explain other terms without saying one of the words on the card.
But you must use an microphone with built-in delay. So you will hear yourself but with delay.

name.value: Bottoms Up: Banana Skin Game – Unzip Game 4

item.description:
One of the games in the "banana skin game series"

Throw bottoms and score points by flicking them against each other.

A classical drinking game (with or without alcohol). Court ladies und knights find themselves here to a drink together, to see who is the most powerful of them all. 
At the beginning, everyone gives a bid in slurs to get one of the three artifacts. After everybody has paid her or his bid, the game begins.
Now everyone in turn draws a card from the stack in the middle and fulfills the respective tasks on this card. 
Tasks can be for example: make new rules or plays "I pack my suitcase".
If you manage to play all the cards through the group wins and everybody are knighted.

Fruit Go Racing is a racing game where players drive special fruit-shaped cars. During the game the players will have to optimize the drawing and the use of the cards (the fuel of the cars) paying attention to the position on the race track and try to upgrade their "Fruitcar", collecting the gems released by the other cars!

—description from the publisher

name.value: 真贋のはざまで (Shingan no Hazama de)

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
Astrahys is a skirmish miniature game for two or more players in a fantasy world.

Each player play with a battle group (5-6 miniatures). Each miniature generates actions to create a pool. All actions in each round are allocated to the miniatures your group.

Astrahys is a tactical game based on the anticipation and strategy.

A bad tactical choice could be fatal...

—description from the publisher

name.value: Miss Tree and the Stolen Broomstick

item.description:
Who stole the prize broomstick "Joystick 2001?"

Miss Tree is very proud of her prize broomstick which she calls "Joystick" but someone has stolen it from the cabinet at Toad Stool Hall. Eight pupils are suspected of the crime but only one is guilty.

Host your own party to find out who is the guilty suspect.

—description from the publisher

name.value: Murder Mystery Party: Murder at the Feelgood Fitness Centre

item.description:
Who murdered Wally Noveau-Richards?

The time is the present, and it's Happy Hour at the grand re-opening of The Feelgood Fitness Centre. Wally goes to take a swim in the newly revamped pool but never returns to the party. He is found dead in the pool but who sent him to his watery grave?

—description from the publisher

name.value: Murder Mystery Party: Murder at Sandy Bay Surf Club

item.description:
The time is the present and the millionaire owner of the sandy bay surf club, Mr Rupert Baywatch has been found stabbed to death in the sand dunes during a swinging nighttime barbecue down on the beach. Why should anyone want him dead?

Host your own party and find out why Rupert's all washed up!

—description from the publisher
Build a sculpture with the pieces and make the other players guessing.

name.value: ダイスガールズ第1弾 (Dice Girls Track 1)

link.value: ダイスガールズ Track 3 (Dice Girls Track 3)
ダイスガールズ Track 4 (Dice Girls Track 4)
ダイスガールズ Track 5 (Dice Girls Track 5)
ダイスガールズ Track２ (Dice Girls Track 2)

item.description:
Shy Monsters is an asymmetric bluffing game for two players in which a player builds a dungeon and his opponent tries to escape from it.
The Dungeon Master leads a band of shy monsters, but he will have to respect their favourite places in the dungeon, otherwise they will not attack the Hero. As for the latter, he must decipher properly the dungeon’s structure and use its special actions soundly to escape from it alive.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

name.value: 16-K AM Presents The Heritage of Council Bluffs

item.description: Monopoly Style game based on the City of Council Bluffs, Iowa United States.

You are a troll server. And as each and every average troll server, you must do your best to satisfy clients, and hope to earn generous tips, or even profit from some particular favors. Because your clients are strange people.... I mean, are they actually people? Anyway, choose your client wisely, and serve it at the good speed, to not be doubled, or worse, have your plate spilled out on the floor. Whatever, a warthog nicknamed the Troll waits to guzzle all unclaimed dishes, and he's doing it so well that the inn is called after him: welcome to Troll Inn!

Each turn, you serve a client, trying to gain the best tips, make their values evolve, and take benefits of their favors. At the end of a turn, the Troll tosses out some remnants, most of the time on the clients, making them leave the inn. Once only 3 clients or less remain in the tavern, doors close and it's time to count your pay. The richest server wins the game.

—description from the publisher

name.value: Murder Mystery Party: Murder in the Air

item.description:
Who killed Mr Valentine D Plaza?

The time is the present and Mr D Plaza together with several of his friends and associates are on board Concorde returning to New York. The aircraft is cruising smoothly at Mach II, twice the speed of sound, when Valentine is taken ill and dies. It looks like foul play but who should want him dead?

—description from the publisher

name.value: Murder à la carte: Death in Venice

item.description:
It's September 1946 and - following a wartime break - the Venice Film Festival is once again being staged, attracting the biggest stars of world cinema to Northern Italy, and bringing a touch of glamour back to this most romantic of European cities.

Romeo Beechini, the young head of an old wealthy Venetian family, has invited a mixed group to dinner. Unfortunately one of his house-guests, Leonardo di Capulet, the bright new hope of Hollywood, has just been found dead in his bath. When it turns out he didn't die of natural causes, only one conclusion can be drawn: one or more of the guests has killed him.

—description from the publisher

name.value: Murder Mystery Party: Murder on the Med

item.description:
Who killed Charles Taxwell?

Charles Taxwell the well known international business tycoon is cruising the med on his luxury yacht "Jellyfish II". The family are busy preparing for a special party at their beach side villa when they dock in Los Amigos. Everyone is looking forward to an exciting day but behind the scenes all is not well. The party was just beginning but it was just ending for Charlies Taxwell who was found dead.

Host your own party and find out why he ended up like a fish out of water!

—description from the publisher

Who did the dance of death?

It's the eve of the final of Dance Factor and the competition is tighter than the male dancers leotards. Crane Breville Cowl decides to host a pre-final bash to relieve everyone's tension and invites the finalists and his colleagues to come along, but all he gets for his troubles is a stiletto heel in the head.

Host your own party to find out who stepped on Cranes parade.

—description from the publisher

name.value: Murder à la carte: Pyramids of Giza

item.description:
Egypt 1924. Two years ago the tomb of Tutankhamun was uncovered and caused a worldwide sensation. Now an even more remarkable discovery has been made with the opening of the tomb of king Men-her-Ra by Sir John Willard and Felix Bleibner.

But within days, Tragedy has truck, Sir John dies suddenly of heart failure and two weeks later Blebibner too is dead, struck down by blood poisoning. When the latter's nephew, Rupert Bleibner, commits suicide in New York, the rumors of a curse reach hysteria.

Hercule Poirot summons the surviving members of the expedition to Cairo, where he will uncover the truth. Are these three deaths connected? Are there supernatural forces at work? Or is one of his dinner guests a murder.

—description from the publisher

A libre fantasy style strategic card game

As you battle your opponents summoning creatures and casting spells, you’ll have to defend your cities, manage your resources and power supply and conjure up a strategical plan to beat your opponents. Will you be the one that brings order to the warring factions in Irdiya? Will you challenge all and utter the words ‘Amin duna, ilya lanta’?

This turn based game allows a player to gather resources, build cities, cast and move creatures, recruit an army, play magic spells or interrupt an opponents' play. Each turn the player may launch an attack on an a target city. On opponents' turns players may have to bravely defend their cities against the marauding enemy's army. Lose all of your cities and you're out of the game.

Following the tradition of many great CCG's, the game supports both casual as in depth strategic game play. Furthermore it offers an unique resource system and adds a spacial dimension that lets the player decide how and where to deploy their creatures.

—the arcmage team

Who Poisoned Lucky Eddie Merino?

The time is the present. The place is Newmarket. Lucky Eddie Merino, Head trainer for the O'Callaghna Stables and trainer for "Royal Lady" Derby and Gold Cup Winner, was found dead in the tack room of the O'Callagham Stables. He died of heart failure caused by the drug Eqimyotel. Why was Lucky Eddie poisoned?
We are gathered here in the midst of a family feud filled with lies and deception to solve the mystery of the Triple Crown Affair.

—description from the publisher

Los Angeles, 1934. In the city of Angeld, even the angels have dirty faces. To survive on these mean streets, a guy has to be tough, and a dame has to be tougher. Lou Harger thought he was a tough guy, thought he could handle himself. He was wrong, dead wrong, and now he's just dead....Murdered...and the the $20,000 that he won on the roulette table is missing.

Legendary private eye Philip Marlowe has been investigating, and he's summoned together the principal suspects in his enquiries. One, or more, of the guests at dinner is a killer. It's your task to find out who the guilty party is before it's too late.

—description from the publisher

name.value: Jr. RangerLand North American Animal Tracks Matching Game

item.description:
Memory challenge card game for 1 or more players ages 4+. 48 cards comprising 24 pairs of matching animal and tracks.

The cards are a unique take on matching. Each pair of “matching” cards comprises a North American animal card and animal tracks / footprints card (that references back to the animal card).

Samburu is a strategic game in which two players manage villages of nilotic peoples and the roles the individuals fulfil in the tribes.

Regularly, the villages enter into competitions to measure their strength and success perpetuating traditions. By conducting initiations and ceremonial rituals, among other happenstances, players can make sure the guardians they select to represent their tribe are recognised as worthy of respect.

In game terms, players manipulate stacks of discs of various colours over a number of rounds concluded by scoring both for population of their settlements (height of the stacks), as well as the rank of their guardians (the top disc in each stack).

Each round consists of players drafting action cards that rotate in and out of a shared pool, temporarily making some of them unavailable to both players. At the end of 4 rounds, the player who accumulated the most points wins the game.

WitClash is a tile based strategy game. The goal is deceptively simple: to be the first in completing a 3 x 3 grid of colored Asset Tiles, arranged in 3 columns: green, red or blue, for a total of 36 units.

However, such a goal is enabled (or hindered) by Action Tiles, which have an offensive or defensive capacity, and are therefore the leading characters in this game. The diversity of Action Tiles (black background) provide tremendous flexibility for strategy planning. The action arsenal consists of 12 different actions, for a total of 48 units. Namely:


 Steal * Disarm
 Swap * Boomerang
 Lock * Undo
 Key * Shuffle
 Peek * Black Hole
 Pause * Wild Card


Asset and Action tiles are shuffled together in a central tile pool. Tiles are randomly drawn but, from there on, only strategy will prevail.

—description from the publisher

The game of knowledge about the weather: Whether the child plays alone or with others, the tiptoi reader brings him a lot of knowledge on the subject of the weather. Exciting games allow you to discover and deepen your knowledge. Thanks to the tiptoi player, players pass tests, receive indications and explore the weather machine.
Exciting game mechanism with wheels and an original progression ladder;
8 themes: precipitation, wind, clouds, seasons, clothing, extreme events, weather forecasts and climate zones;
A fun discovery of natural phenomena and weather relations.

—description from the publisher

The Occulite Tribes are expanding and alliances between them are fluid as you work to accomplish your objectives.

A trick-taking game with several interesting and engaging twists set in the Occulite universe. Select a number of different Tribes (suits) to play with depending on the number of players, each with their own unique effect on the game. Use the tribes' alliances to play on suit, or use card effects to give you the advantage going forward as you play your hand to achieve the objective that you select each hand.

Played as Every Eye for Themselves, or in Alliance mode, The Trick with Occulites is a fresh take on a well loved genre.

—description from the publisher

Who blew herr up?

It's the end of the Second World War and Herr Bevore is throwing a party at the Café Resistance. Everyone is invited, even his victors, but before the party begins he is bumped off in his bedroom by an explosive Roquewurst sausage.

Host your own party to find out who flambéed Herr Bevore!

—description from the publisher

An exciting football match for two players.

During the game the players take turns, setting their pieces on any space of the football field. To score, a player has to connect the goal of the opponent in a continuous line with the edge of his side. If both players block the path so that no goal can be reached, it is a draw.

The first player to score five times wins the game.

—user summary

Nutze deine Chance ...

Wer führt seine Mannschaft
zu Tor, Sieg und Titel ?

Ein spannendes Fußballspiel
für schnelle Taktiker

—description from the publisher
